Article.Abstract: The murine CD8(+) cytotoxic-T-lymphocyte (CTL) repertoire appears to be quite limited in response to influenza A viruses. The CTL responses to influenza A virus in humans were examined to determine if the CTL repertoire is also very limited. Bulk cultures revealed that a number of virus proteins were recognized in CTL assays. CTL lines were isolated from three donors for detailed study and found to be specific for epitopes on numerous influenza A viral proteins. Eight distinct CD8(+) CTL lines were isolated from donor 1. The proteins recognized by these cell lines included the nucleoprotein (NP), matrix protein (M1), nonstructural protein 1 (NS1), polymerases (PB1 and PB2), and hemagglutinin (HA). Two CD4(+) cell lines, one specific for neuraminidase (NA) and the other specific for M1, were also characterized. These CTL results were confirmed by precursor frequency analysis of peptide-specific gamma interferon-producing cells detected by ELISPOT. The epitopes recognized by 6 of these 10 cell lines have not been previously described; 8 of the 10 cell lines were cross-reactive to subtype H1N1, H2N2, and H3N2 viruses, 1 cell line was cross-reactive to subtypes H1N1 and H2N2, and 1 cell line was subtype H1N1 specific. A broad CTL repertoire was detected in the two other donors, and cell lines specific for the NP, NA, HA, M1, NS1, and M2 viral proteins were isolated. These findings indicate that the human memory CTL response to influenza A virus is broadly directed to epitopes on a wide variety of proteins, unlike the limited response observed following infection of mice.
Article.ArticleTitle: Human cytotoxic T-lymphocyte repertoire to influenza A viruses.
Article.Affiliations: Center for Infectious Disease and Vaccine Research, University of Massachusetts Medical Center, Worcester, Massachusetts 01655, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antigens, Viral;Epitopes;HLA Antigens;Viral Matrix Proteins;Viral Proteins;Interferon-gamma;Neuraminidase
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Adult; Animals; Antigens, Viral; Cell Line; Cross Reactions; Epitope Mapping; Epitopes; HLA Antigens; Humans; Immunologic Memory; In Vitro Techniques; Influenza A virus(classification; immunology); Interferon-gamma(biosynthesis); Mice; Neuraminidase(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Viral Matrix Proteins(immunology); Viral Proteins(immunology)

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity. The PBMC were restimulated in bulk culture at day 0 and day 7 with gamma-irradiated autologous PBMC infected with influenza A virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1). At day 14, influenza virus-specific CTL clones were established by limiting dilution.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<SUP>+</SUP> cell line 10-1C4, which recognizes epitope NP174-184 and was expanded by stimulation with influenza A/PR/8/34 (H1N1), displayed cross-reactivity with influenza A/Jap/305/57 (H2N2) and A/Johan/33/94 (H3N2). Line 10-1C4 also lyses target cells infected with vaccinia virus carrying an influenza PR8 NP minigene.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity. The PBMC were restimulated in bulk culture at day 0 and day 7 with gamma-irradiated autologous PBMC infected with influenza A virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1). At day 14, influenza virus-specific CTL clones were established by limiting dilution.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<SUP>+</SUP> cell line 10-1C4, previously shown to recognize source protein, lysed target cells pulsed with epitope. The use of partially HLA-matched allogeneic B cells allowed for the determination of B27 as the restricting allele.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Bulk PBMC cultures have a high frequency of epitope-specific cells, confirming that these are not rare CTLs generated by the cloning process.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity. The PBMC were restimulated in bulk culture at day 0 and day 7 with gamma-irradiated autologous PBMC infected with influenza A virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1). At day 14, influenza virus-specific CTL clones were established by limiting dilution.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4<SUP>+</SUP> cytotoxic cell line 3E5, previously shown to recognize source protein, lysed target cells pulsed with epitope. The restricting alleles could not be determined because of failure to lyse available partially matched allogeneic B cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4<SUP>+</SUP> cell line 3E5, which recognizes epitope NP254-264 and was expanded by stimulation with influenza A/PR/8/34 (H1N1), displayed cross-reactivity with influenza A/Jap/305/57 (H2N2) and A/Johan/33/94 (H3N2). Line 3E5 also lysed target cells infected with vaccinia virus carrying an influenza NP minigene.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Bulk PBMC cultures have a significant frequency of epitope-specific cells, confirming that these are not rare CTLs generated by the cloning process.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity. The PBMC were restimulated in bulk culture at day 0 and day 7 with gamma-irradiated autologous PBMC infected with influenza A virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1). At day 14, influenza virus-specific CTL clones were established by limiting dilution.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8<SUP>+</SUP> cell line 124, which recognizes epitope M2_7-15 and was expanded by stimulation with influenza A/PR/8/34 (H1N1), displayed cross-reactivity with influenza A/Jap/305/57 (H2N2), but no cross-reactivity with influenza A/Johan/33/94 (H3N2). Line 124 also lysed target cells infected with vaccinia virus carrying an influenza M2 minigene.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4<SUP>+</SUP> cytotoxic cell line 77, previously shown to recognize source protein, lysed target cells pulsed with epitope. The use of partially HLA-matched allogeneic B cells allowed for the determination of DR3 as the restricting allele.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity. The PBMC were restimulated in bulk culture at day 0 and day 7 with gamma-irradiated autologous PBMC infected with influenza A virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (H1N1). AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD4<SUP>+</SUP> cell line 77, which recognizes epitope NS1_34-42 and was expanded by stimulation with influenza A/PR/8/34 (H1N1), displayed cross-reactivity with influenza A/Jap/305/57 (H2N2) and A/Johan/33/94 (H3N2). Line 77 also lysed target cells infected with vaccinia virus carrying an influenza NS1 minigene.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: PBMC were obtained from a healthy donor with previous influenza infection(s) since the PBMCs had evidence of anti-influenza CTL activity.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The frequency of precursors in bulk PBMC cultures was very low (<1/500,000), but a CTL cell line (10-2C2) derived from the same donor lysed targets pulsed with the epitope.
